boolean
perPlayer

Indicates whether the listener will be called once, or if it will be called once for every player in the game.

Public Properties

perPlayer gmm.d.ts:801 
perPlayer: boolean

boolean

Indicates whether the listener will be called once, or if it will be called once for every player in the game.

The goal of this option is to facilitate self-interaction within a player, when needed (for example, to add new abilities, or to draw player-specific HUD).

This option only affects "roundStart" and "step".

If set to true, the listener will be called multiple times, and it will be given the ID of a different player every time. It will do so in the order the ids are in. Example: if there are two players, one with ID 2 and another with ID 5, the function will be called twice; the first time it will be given the ID 2, then the other time, the ID 5.

If set to false, the listener will be called once, and no variables will be given.

Summary
Public Properties
